ygData.subject: Re: Twisting question
ygData.msgSnippet: At lvl 8 I missed a lot too especially the Hymn song.  But now at lvl 9, i missed like once every hour.  My Charisma is 75, DEX is 99.  I have max out my
ygData.messageBody:
At lvl 8 I missed a lot too especially the Hymn song. But now at lvl 9, i
missed like once every hour. My Charisma is 75, DEX is 99. I have max out
my skill. I hoped this help.

Your Friendly Rogue and Bard,
Hammerpaw and Samiam


-----Original Message-----
From: Roop Dirump [mailto:roop@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 7:32 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Twisting question


From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>

Hm, but that does not answer why Gatlin misses notes less than %33 of the
time, he estimated. I rarely missed notes at 8th level. I'm certain skill
level has a lot to do with missing notes, but would not be surprised if
charisma or some other stat was figured into a formula for such a purpose.
Either that, or Galtin has a bugged character. He stated his skill was 45,
and he should not be having that problem.

Roop

This could all be tested with a scientific method, but would require too
much time and gold for me to attempt it.


>From: "hawkeye17" <hawkeye17@...>
>
>I am currently 20th level and have found my stats have no significant
affect
>on song perfomance at all. I have also spoken with other bards who have
more
>Dex or more Chr, and their results are the same as mine. Whether or not
"you
>miss a note" is dependent upon your Skill Level with that instrument. The
>higher your skill becomes, the less you miss notes. When i reached level 16
>and got Tarews Aquatic Ayre, i began to finally train my Wind. I noticed
>that i would miss the notes 6 or 7 out of 10 tries initially. As my skill
>rose, my missed notes dropped off noticably. At 20th, I have reached Master
>in all Instruments and hardly miss notes at all.
>The moral is, forget about starting character stats as Skill stats are more
>imortant. My advice to any new Bard is, put ALL your bonus points into
>Strength. The stronger you are the more damage you do, and you can carry
>greater weight(i.e. Platemail AND Loot) without being encumbered....both
>tangible assets. Just my 2 cents!
>
>Garet Wynn
>
>Bard...Tarew Mar
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: NeXuS <nexus@...>
>To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Date: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 12:24 AM
>Subject: [eqbards] Re: Twisting question

>>From: "NeXuS" <nexus@...>

and
>>dex to 100 (Half-Elf) and put the remaining to Str. I hardly ever miss a
>>note.
>>
>>Koden

>>>
>>> Wow, you say you only succeed beginning a song less than one third of
the
>>> time? Something definitely sounds amiss! And irritating, at that!
>>>
>>> What are all your stats? I always thought charisma would have a bearing
>>on
>>> it, but you stated you increased that with dex and strength at character
>>> creation. It is quite likely dexterity as no bearing on musical skills,
>>> yours being so high. Do you have any exceptionally low stat???
>>>
>>> (I have no idea the formula used to determine when a song can be
>>> successfully started, but I do know that the singing skill or instrument
>>> skill will effect the strength of a song, ie. Hymn of Restoration heals
>>more
>>> and more the higher one's string skill.)
>>>
>>> Roop
